etymology.description: 號(号) (hào, "mark; sign") + 碼(码) (mǎ, "code; number") = number; code
etymology.interpretation: The word 號碼(号码) (hàomǎ) combines 號(号) (hào, "mark; sign") and 碼(码) (mǎ, "code; number") to refer to a sequence of symbols or digits used for identification, typically as a number or code in various contexts such as telephone numbers and serial numbers.
etymology.simplification: 号 simplified from 號; 码 simplified from 碼

examples.chinese: 请拨这个号码(請撥這個號碼)。
我把号码记在本子上(我把號碼記在本子上)，以免忘记(以免忘記)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ bǎ hàomǎ jì zài běnzi shàng, yǐmiǎn wàngjì.
examples.english: I write down the number in my notebook so that I won't forget.

examples.chinese: 联系时(聯繫時)，请提供你的号码(請提供你的號碼)。
examples.pinyin: Liánxì shí, qǐng tígōng nǐ de hàomǎ.
examples.english: When contacting, please provide your number.
